content:
Hi All,
Is there a Implementation Guide which consider the Gender Identity requirements from USCDI?

Any guidance on this would be much appreciated !!

Thank you,
Dheeraj
USCDI's Patient Demographic has birth sex. Is that what you mean?
Gender Identity isn't in USCDIv1. Birth Sex is included in the US Core IG: us-core-birthsex
look at the extensions defined in FHIR core http://build.fhir.org/patient-profiles.html

The gender harmony project (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/The+Gender+Harmony+Project) is preparing to go to ballot in 2021. It won't be a product family implementation guide, but it will help to define some of the concepts (https://confluence.hl7.org/display/VOC/Gender+Harmony+Context+Definitions). This group has a call later today (10/5) if you are interested in the project.
We are looking for gender Identity (USCDI Rule) Implementation guide and profile
@Brett Marquard @Eric Haas
@Dheeraj Kumar Pal there is none - as Cooper said above that is not part of USCDv1 that is what the existing profiles target

While Gender Identity is not in USCDIv1 and I lead the Gender Harmony project and encourage you to review that material as we head to a logical model ballot that should include some example changes we'd like to see in FHIR and elsewhere. I'd like to point out there is regulatory guidance from ONC on expectations for recording gender identity and sexual orientation. I'm not thrilled with this guidance but it does exist in the sections for Paragraphs (a)(5)(i)(D) and (E) in the test method certification guide. I'll note that many in the community working on the gender harmony ballot hope to see this improve once the work is completed.
@Robert McClure Thank you so much for sharing this !! I will go through it .. Also, Please let me know if this is open for to be active participant ?
@Dheeraj Kumar Pal if you mean the GH project, yes anyone can participate. Next meeting is a week from today 4p ET.
